Corporate has officially run out of ideas. Forget pizza parties and kombucha taps — the new cutting-edge office perk for 2025 is… taking your shoes off.

Startups and CEOs are calling it “return to work reinvented,” as if socks and communal shoe racks are going to make you excited to commute again. LinkedIn is full of think pieces about how “shoeless Fridays” will spark creativity, build culture, and apparently fix burnout.

Would you actually go back to the office just to take your shoes off? Or does your office already
title: RTO IS FAILING AND COMPANIES ARE GETTING DESPERATE(NEW PERKS!)
